availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Shively (Green County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Roach Shively in Green County, Kentucky, on August 24, 1843. Father of Sarah "Sallie" White Shively and Price R. Shively. Merchant in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Held an additional eleven enslaved persons in trust for his two children in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 122A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 543.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 69B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Precinct 1, p.425B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 11399.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Green County Marriages, Film 000594644.
